channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 法国农民周六在埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统抵达巴黎参加一年一度的农业展时向他发泄怒火。
item.description:
France’s farmers vented their fury at President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday as he arrived at the annual agricultural show in Paris, a giant fair long seen as a test of presidents’ relationship with the countryside. https://t.co/1t2mk9vbSO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 强奸、杀戮、酷刑：一份严酷的报告提供了新的证据，证明苏丹军方及其敌人准军事组织快速支援部队犯下了骇人听闻的暴行。
item.description:
Rape, killing, torture: A stark report offers new evidence of horrific abuses carried out by Sudan’s military and its enemy, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces. https://t.co/GOaH5hSwpA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 沙米玛-贝古姆（Shamima Begum）在 2015 年十几岁时与两个朋友从伦敦的家中前往叙利亚，加入了 "伊斯兰国 "恐怖组织。
item.description:
Shamima Begum, who traveled from her home in London to Syria with two friends in 2015 when she was a teenager to join the Islamic State terrorist group, has lost her latest bid to regain her British citizenship. https://t.co/obWhHGxDA5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 随着资金涌入英格兰足球低级别联赛，即使是有钱的老板也越来越发现自己无法获得成功。通过 @RorySmith：
item.description:
As money pours into the lower leagues of English soccer, even rich owners are increasingly finding themselves priced out of success. Via @RorySmith: https://t.co/dX0iYFQnBA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 这场大火造成至少 10 人死亡，许多乌克兰难民失去了家园，其他人则忙于重建家园。
item.description:
The fire that killed at least 10 people left many refugees from Ukraine without a home and others scrambling to rebuild their lives https://t.co/Ymfu0TFhOK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 多伦多汽车失窃案频发，令许多居民恼羞成怒，一些人开始创造性地采取威慑措施，比如在住宅车道上安装护柱。
item.description:
An epidemic of auto thefts in Toronto has left many residents exasperated, with some getting creative about deterrence efforts, such as installing bollards in home driveways. https://t.co/440i4ddzw6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 由于以色列的军事进攻，大多数加沙人被逼到了领土的一个小角落里，厕所的严重短缺造成了卫生危机，并导致疾病传播。
item.description:
With most Gazans pushed into a small corner of the territory by Israel’s military offensive, a severe shortage of toilets is posing a sanitation crisis that is spreading disease. https://t.co/qHcRjed3xf

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 美国官员花了数年时间调查贩毒集团与墨西哥总统盟友之间可能存在的联系。根据记录，这项调查最终不了了之。
item.description:
Funcionarios de EE. UU. pasaron años indagando posibles vínculos entre los cárteles de la droga y aliados del presidente de México. La indagatoria, al final, fue dejada de lado, según consta en los registros. https://t.co/4LhI7oqtsp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：俄罗斯反对派领导人阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的女发言人说，他的遗体已归还给他的母亲，结束了他的遗体监护权争夺战。目前尚不清楚他是否会举行公众可以参加的葬礼。
item.description:
Breaking News: Aleksei Navalny’s body was returned to his mother, the Russian opposition leader’s spokeswoman said, ending a custody battle for his remains. It is unclear whether he will get a funeral that the public can attend. https://t.co/wQU2zod7p4

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 球迷和专家认为，韩国体育赛事中女性观众人数众多是由于韩国场馆的安全感。还有人说，韩国强烈的明星崇拜也是一个因素。
item.description:
Aficionados y expertos atribuyen la gran afluencia femenina en los eventos deportivos surcoreanos a la sensación de seguridad en los recintos del país. Otros dicen que influye el intenso culto nacional a las estrellas. https://t.co/ywNrtLOhMq

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 欧洲和其他西方国家领导人齐聚基辅，承诺在美国不情愿的情况下支持乌克兰，而乌克兰军队在战场上遭受的损失却越来越大，俄罗斯人在战场上节节胜利
item.description:
European and other Western leaders gathered in Kyiv to pledge support for Ukraine amid U.S. reluctance, while its troops suffer growing losses on the battlefield, where the Russians have been gaining ground https://t.co/nTn9MEuPJe

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 近两年过去了，只有零星的信息，一个乌克兰家庭仍然希望他们的儿子--一名在马里乌波尔被俄军俘虏的海军陆战队员--能早日回家。
item.description:
After nearly two years and only scraps of information, a Ukrainian family still hopes their son, a marine captured by the Russians in Mariupol, will come home soon. https://t.co/bdEhdCA90I

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡发布了第一份战后加沙计划，但该建议激怒了阿拉伯国家，并遭到巴勒斯坦人的拒绝。
item.description:
Netanyahu issues first plan for post-war Gaza, but the proposal rankled Arab nations and was rejected by Palestinians. https://t.co/KB5E4SANyB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 战争的第三年伊始，乌克兰领导人正试图在俄罗斯的猛烈进攻中找到一条新的前进道路，同时还要面对一系列令人生畏的未知因素。
item.description:
At the beginning of a third year of war, Ukraine’s leaders are trying to find a new path forward amid ferocious Russian assaults, while facing a series of daunting unknowns. https://t.co/hIzQHPGD0A

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 一场大火席卷了西班牙巴伦西亚的一个住宅区，造成至少九人死亡。调查人员正试图确定大火为何在不到一小时的时间内蔓延至两栋建筑。
item.description:
Un incendio arrasó un complejo de viviendas en Valencia, España, en el que murieron al menos 9 personas. Los investigadores intentan determinar por qué las llamas extendieron en menos de una hora a dos edificios. https://t.co/pjQtnmVkAp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班在阻挠瑞典加入北约长达 19 个月之后，批准了瑞典加入北约。
item.description:

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 美国国务卿安东尼-布林肯周五表示，美国政府现在认为以色列在巴勒斯坦领土上新建定居点 "不符合国际法"，推翻了特朗普政府制定的政策。
item.description:
Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday that the American government now considers new Israeli settlements in Palestinian territories to be “inconsistent with international law,” reversing a policy set under the Trump administration. https://t.co/atGQQXVaEv

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 法国新任总理加布里埃尔-阿塔尔希望接替马克龙总统。但首先，他必须击退极右翼势力，在躁动的公众面前明确自己的定位。
item.description:
Gabriel Attal, France's new prime minister, wants to succeed President Macron. But first he must see off the far right and define himself before a restive public. https://t.co/9MmNBxQdWV

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 一名加拿大法官裁定，一名男子驾驶卡车撞向一个穆斯林家庭的五名成员，其致命暴行是出于白人至上主义思想动机的恐怖主义行为。他被判处终身监禁，25 年内不得假释。
item.description:
A Canadian judge ruled that the deadly rampage of a man who drove his truck into five members of a Muslim family was an act of terrorism motivated by white supremacist ideology. He's sentenced to life with no possibility of parole for 25 years. https://t.co/uhyevbYzYO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 这一僵局引发了众多名人对纳瓦尔尼先生家人的支持，他们发布视频要求俄罗斯当局交出尸体。
item.description:
The standoff has led to an outpouring of support for Mr. Navalny’s family by celebrities, who released videos demanding that Russian authorities hand over the body. https://t.co/2Q55AVmI2h

item.title: 周五上午，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊在布宜诺斯艾利斯接待了美国国务卿安东尼-布林肯（Antony J. Blinken），双方讨论了米莱伊总统正在以各种方式重塑与美国一致的外交政策。
item.description:
President Javier Milei of Argentina hosted U.S. Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken in Buenos Aires on Friday morning to discuss the various ways Mr. Milei is reshaping foreign policy in line with the United States. https://t.co/D3Fua55Tnf

item.title: 德国离有限数量的娱乐用大麻合法化又近了一步。

Germany is one step closer to legalizing limited amounts of marijuana for recreational use. https://t.co/HLCOP9FK0C

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京以史为鉴，将自己定位在俄罗斯过去统治者的境界。批评者认为，他对权力的掌控并不像看上去那么牢固。
item.description:

item.title: 许多乌克兰人说，俄罗斯的入侵分为两个阶段：第一个阶段是十年前，俄罗斯派兵越过边境，进行了一次不为人知的军事干预；第二个阶段是两年前，俄罗斯开始全面进攻。
item.description:
Russia’s invasion came in two phases, many Ukrainians say: the first a decade ago, when it sent soldiers over the border in an unacknowledged military intervention, and the second when it began its full assault two years ago. https://t.co/9SpGVfbug1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 非洲各国政府正在努力遏制向中国出口驴皮，因为中国对一种传统药物的需求正威胁着运输和农业所需的动物。
item.description:
African governments are seeking to curb donkey skin exports to China, where demand for a traditional medicine is threatening animals needed for transportation and agriculture. https://t.co/XOpk2IRhep

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024

item.title: 西班牙巴伦西亚市一座高层住宅楼发生火灾，造成至少 4 人死亡，14 人失踪。
item.description:
A day after a fire roared through a high-rise residential complex in the Spanish city of Valencia, killing at least four people and leaving at least 14 missing, there were fears on Friday that those numbers could rise. https://t.co/9AWar3bLK2

item.title: 以色列军队在这场给加沙平民造成毁灭性伤亡的战争中重创了哈马斯，但官员们说，哈马斯仍然是一个威胁。
item.description:
Israeli forces have delivered a major blow to Hamas in a war that has taken a devastating toll on the civilian population of Gaza, but Hamas remains a threat, officials say. https://t.co/K0upAKEBHk

item.title: 拉丁美洲的监狱已成为帮派的庇护所和招募中心，这些帮派对囚犯不受限制地行使权力，为他们提供保护或食物等基本物品以换取金钱。
item.description:
Las prisiones latinoamericanas se han convertido en refugios y centros de reclutamiento de bandas que ejercen una autoridad irrestricta sobre los presos, a quienes brindan protección o artículos básicos, como comida, a cambio de dinero. https://t.co/ADz8HNoOvd

item.title: 以色列在加沙地带持续开展的军事行动正面临着谴责浪潮，甚至其最坚定的盟友美国的支持也受到了考验
item.description:

item.title: 国际刑警组织是世界上最大的警察组织。但它也是独裁者和专制者用来对付政敌的新式武器。以下是国际刑警组织被用作骚扰工具的四种方式。
item.description:
Interpol es la mayor organización policial del mundo. Pero también es un arma novedosa que dictadores y autócratas usan contra sus enemigos políticos. He aquí cuatro formas en que se ha utilizado a la Interpol como instrumento de acoso. https://t.co/144DAnFjqw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 23, 2024
